  {
    "file_path": "h2q_project/tests/test_quaternion_ops.py",
    "content": "import unittest
import numpy as np
from h2q_project.quaternion_ops import quaternion_multiply, quaternion_conjugate, quaternion_norm, quaternion_normalize

class TestQuaternionOps(unittest.TestCase):

    def test_quaternion_multiply_numerical_stability(self):
        # Generate a large number of random quaternions
        num_quaternions = 1000
        quaternions1 = np.random.rand(num_quaternions, 4)
        quaternions2 = np.random.rand(num_quaternions, 4)

        # Normalize the quaternions to avoid potential magnitude issues
        quaternions1 = quaternion_normalize(quaternions1)
        quaternions2 = quaternion_normalize(quaternions2)

        # Perform quaternion multiplication
        results = []
        for i in range(num_quaternions):
            results.append(quaternion_multiply(quaternions1[i], quaternions2[i]))
        results = np.array(results)

        # Check if the resulting quaternions are still normalized (close to unit length)
        norms = quaternion_norm(results)
        self.assertTrue(np.allclose(norms, 1.0), "Quaternion multiplication resulted in non-normalized quaternions.")

    def test_quaternion_conjugate(self):
        q = np.array([1, 2, 3, 4])
        q_conj = quaternion_conjugate(q)
        expected_conj = np.array([1, -2, -3, -4])
        self.assertTrue(np.array_equal(q_conj, expected_conj), "Quaternion conjugate test failed.")

    def test_quaternion_norm(self):
        q = np.array([1, 2, 3, 4])
        norm = quaternion_norm(q)
        expected_norm = np.sqrt(1 + 4 + 9 + 16)
        self.assertAlmostEqual(norm, expected_norm, places=7, msg="Quaternion norm test failed.")

    def test_quaternion_normalize(self):
        q = np.array([1, 2, 3, 4])
        q_norm = quaternion_normalize(q)
        norm = quaternion_norm(q_norm)
        self.assertAlmostEqual(norm, 1.0, places=7, msg="Quaternion normalize test failed.")

if __name__ == '__main__':
    unittest.main()"
  }
]
